instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Green light
threads.message:
Water Damage but the board don't looks bad.

No <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
- Short to ground on <RESISTOR>R7006</RESISTOR> Pin 1 - 390Ω (just Ω)

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 0.97V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 0.93V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> - 18V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> - 18V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 1.27V



-
